unsupervised.jamf

Class Factorizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • unsupervised.jamf.Factorizer

  • public class Factorizer
extends java.lang.Object

    Implements a proxy for a python instance running any pymf matrix factorization method.

    Possible factorization methods are provided by the enum Method in this package.

    An example invocation of simplex volume maximization factorization of the zero matrix would look like:

    Factorizer mf = new Factorizer(Method.SIVM, new double[5][5], 2); mf.factorize();

    After the computation has finished, the resulting matrices can be obtained via mf.getW(); // data_dimension x num_bases mf.getH(); // num_bases x num_samples Or, if the factorization method of choice returns matrices S,U,V by getS() and so on.

    Internally, jamf writes a file in hdf5 format to disk that contains the dataset of choice. It also writes a textfile containing python code, which is executed in a subprocess using a python interpreter of choice. Said subprocess writes results to the intermediate hdf5 file which in turn are read and given to the user.

    Note that pymf expects its data in data_dimension x num_examples format. To cope with this issue you can either explicitly transpose the input matrix in java. Or you can use the constructor of Factorizer to specify if the data should be transposed by the python script running pymf. In this case, the data matrix is in any case loaded to memory in python. See the documentation of enableSpeedUpHack() for more details on this.

    Most of the factorization methods accept two parameters:
    data - double matrix num_bases - number of basis vectors

    The Factorizer class is able to cope with the fact, that e.g. SVD does not accept a num_bases parameter. The parameter of the constructor of Factorizer is in this case just ignored.

    Some methods accept more parameters. These can be set via several setSOMETHING() methods. In case the user sets a parameter that is not accepted by the method of choice, this parameter is ignored.

    This class needs python in the system path. And depends on the HDObject library. The python packages
    * scipy
    * numpy
    * h5pyy
    * cvxopt
    * pymf
    need to be installed, as well.

    This Class was developed for pymf 0.1.7 for python 2.7

    Author:
    "Pascal Welke - Institut IGG Geoinformation Bonn"

    • Method Detail

      • transposeData

        public void transposeData(boolean transpose)
        pymf expects matrices that have the shape data_dimension x num_samples. Most other programs (especially HSVap) store their data in transposed form. Note, that if you transpose the data, the data will be loaded into memory by python.
        Parameters:
        transpose -

      • setDirectory

        public void setDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
        Set the directory, the temporary files will be stored in
        Parameters:
        directory -

      • enableSpeedupHack

        public void enableSpeedupHack(boolean b)
        If the parameter is set to true, the python script loads the content of the hdf5 file to main memory. If set to false, the data may reside on disk and is loaded sequentially on access by the hdf library h5py. Exception: If the data will be transposed by the python script, the data will always be loaded to memory. Remember: The matrices are assumed to be large...

      • setRrank

        public void setRrank(java.lang.String rank)
        The methods CUR and CMD accept the parameters rrank and crank.
        Parameters:

      • setDistMeasure

        public void setDistMeasure(java.lang.String d)
        SIVM accepts a parameter called dist_measure. Possible values can be found as constants l1, l2, kl, cosine

      • generateReadFileCode

        public java.lang.String generateReadFileCode()
        Creates Python code to factorize a given matrix that is stored in a hdf5 file.
        Parameters:
        fileName - name of the data file
        h5Path - path to the dataset inside the hdf5 file
        method - specifies the factorization method
        num_bases - number of bases
        niter - number of iterations
        Returns:
        code string that can be executed by the python interpreter

      • getNumBases

        public int getNumBases()
        Return the number of bases that are used to factorize a matrix. Returns num_bases. If the chosen method is CHNMF, it returns baseSel
        Returns:

      • setPythonExecutable

        public void setPythonExecutable(java.lang.String pathToExecutable)
        It is possible to choose any python distribution. If this method is not used by the user to give the path to a python executable, jamf calls the system python (i.e. the one that is executed when typing "python" to the command line. This then must be compatible with the requirements defined in the documentation of this class.
        Parameters:
        pathToExecutable -

      • setInternalH5Path

        public void setInternalH5Path(java.lang.String path)
        Set the path to the dataset inside the temporary hdf5file. See FileIO.writeData() for documentation.
        Parameters:
        path -

      • factorize

        public void factorize()
               throws HDFException,
                      java.io.IOException,
                      java.lang.InterruptedException,
                      PythonException
        The core method of this class. Writes the data to disk, creates a python script file, runs the script and waits for it to terminate. After that, the get... methods can be used to obtain the results of the computations.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong while writing the scriptfile
        java.lang.InterruptedException - if interprocess communication fails
        PythonException - if python encounters an error
        HDFException - if writing the data somehow fails

      • getH

        public org.jblas.DoubleMatrix getH()
                            throws HDFException,
                                   java.util.NoSuchElementException
        Return the result matrix H, if factorize has finished and the factorizing method returns H.
        Returns:
        DoubleMatrix
        Throws:
        HDFException - if there is a problem reading from the file
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the factorizing method does not provide an output named H
